name: Red Hat, Inc.
title: Technical Account Manager - Riyadh, Saudi Arabia
description: about the job: red hat's technical services team is looking for an experienced, enterprise-level engineer to join us as a openshift technical account manager (tam) in riyadh, saudi. in this role, you'll work with a small set of key customers to provide hands-on technical and architectural guidance for the red hat openshift container platform. at red hat, customer support includes far more than just “break-fix” solutions. customers get industry-leading resources that enable their technical environments to run efficiently, so they can focus on growing their businesses. technical account management is a premium support offering that builds, maintains, and grows long-lasting customer loyalty between red hat and our customers. you will forge relationships with your customers, develop a deep technical understanding of their red hat implementation, share technical best practices and act as point of contact for any major incidents, managing the customer’s expectations and communications through resolution of such incidents. you will tailor support for each customer's environment, facilitate collaboration with their other vendors and advocate on their behalf. at the same time, you'll work closely with our engineering, research and development, product management, and global support teams to debug, test, and resolve issues. the ideal tam is a team player, enjoys working hard, exhibits professionalism, is dedicated to meeting and exceeding expectations, building relationships, has excellent collaboration skills, is able to learn new technologies quickly and uses their time efficiently. what you will do: develop relationships with key business and it stakeholders and become an expert on a customer’s implementation by understanding their top business goals and priorities. perform technical reviews and share knowledge to proactively identify and prevent issues forewarn customers of technology changes or potential disruptions to their service and advice on mitigation strategies. provide advice and guidance to customers about their current and future red hat products; troubleshoot technical issues and drive issue escalation with red hat and customer teams complete analysis and present periodic reviews of operational performance to customer leadership manage customer use cases and maintain clear and concise case documentation create customer engagement plans and keep the documentation on the customer's environment updated manage and grow customer relationships by delivering attentive, relationship-based support build a sense of trust with customers and serve as their advocate within red hat contribute internally to the red hat team, share knowledge and best practices with team members, contribute to internal projects and initiatives, and serve as a subject matter expert (sme) and mentor for specific technical or process areas partner closely with red hat engineering, product management, and technical support teams to debug, test, and resolve issues travel, as necessary, to visit customers and attend events within the region learn new technologies quickly, including topics like container orchestration, container registries, container build strategies, and microservices on container platforms establish and maintain parity with red hat cloud technologies strategy engage with red hat’s product engineering teams to help develop solution patterns, based on customer engagements, as well as personal experience, that drive platform adoption engage with red hat’s field teams, customers, and partners to ensure a positive cloud technology experience and a successful outcome resulting in long-term enterprise success communicate how specific red hat cloud solutions and our cloud roadmap align to customer use cases what you will bring: 5 years experience in a support, development, engineering, or quality assurance organisation ability to manage and grow existing enterprise customer relationships by delivering proactive, relationship-based support outstanding verbal and written communication skills; ability to convey complex information to customers clearly and concisely competent comprehension of enterprise architecture and strategic business drivers ability to manage multiple issues and projects with an eye for detail direct experience with a variety of hardware vendors the following are considered a plus: experience in system management, cloud or server virtualization bachelor's degree in a technology-related discipline, preferably computer science or engineering red hat certified engineer (rhce) prior experience in a technical leadership or mentorship role experience with training and presentation delivery expertise with enterprise cloud solutions like platform-as-a-service (openshift by red hat), containers, kubernetes, cloud management (red hat cloudforms), and it automation (ansible automation platform by red hat) #li-mr3 about red hat red hat is the world’s leading provider of enterprise open source software solutions, using a community-powered approach to deliver high-performing linux, cloud, container, and kubernetes technologies. spread across 40+ countries, our associates work flexibly across work environments, from in-office, to office-flex, to fully remote, depending on the requirements of their role. red hatters are encouraged to bring their best ideas, no matter their title or tenure. we're a leader in open source because of our open and inclusive environment. we hire creative, passionate people ready to contribute their ideas, help solve complex problems, and make an impact. diversity, equity & inclusion at red hat red hat’s culture is built on the open source principles of transparency, collaboration, and inclusion, where the best ideas can come from anywhere and anyone. when this is realized, it empowers people from diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences to come together to share ideas, challenge the status quo, and drive innovation. our aspiration is that everyone experiences this culture with equal opportunity and access, and that all voices are not only heard but also celebrated. we hope you will join our celebration, and we welcome and encourage applicants from all the beautiful dimensions of diversity that compose our global village. equal opportunity policy (eeo) red hat is proud to be an equal name: Elbait Consultants
title: Process Engineer - Tissue Factory
description: the role we are seeking a highly motivated and skilled process engineer to join our dynamic team at our state-of-the-art tissue production facility in jeddah, saudi arabia. the ideal candidate will have a strong background in paper manufacturing processes, specifically within tissue production. you will play a critical role in optimizing manufacturing operations, enhancing product quality, and implementing innovative technologies to improve efficiency. join us to contribute to the sustainability and growth of our operations in this exciting industry. responsibilities: - analyze and optimize production processes in the tissue manufacturing line to improve yield and efficiency. - design and implement process improvements and cost-saving initiatives. - collaborate with cross-functional teams, including quality, maintenance, and production, to troubleshoot issues and ensure consistent product quality. - conduct data analysis and use statistical methods to monitor process performance and identify areas for improvement. - ensure adherence to safety and environmental regulations across all production processes. - participate in the commissioning and startup of new equipment and technologies within the facility. - develop and maintain process documentation, including standard operating procedures (sops) and process flow diagrams. - train and mentor junior engineers and plant operators on process improvements and best practices. requirements - bachelor's degree in chemical engineering, industrial engineering, or a related field. - minimum of 3 years of experience in process engineering, preferably in the paper or tissue manufacturing industry. - strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on continuous improvement. - proficient in process simulation software and data analysis tools, such as minitab or similar. - excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively within teams and cross-functional departments. - knowledge of safety regulations and environmental compliance practices within manufacturing operations. - ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously. about the company elbait is a boutique type of executive search & recruitment management consulting firm based in dubai. the unique understanding about the market needs, cultural awareness and professionalism enable the firm to offer its services to diversified portfolio of clients that operates in the me region. elbait is committed to seek the most suitable professionals on international, regional as well as national basis. elbait committed to have well-defined partnership with clients to meet their talent acquisition and executive needs on both practice and function basis. in addition, it committed to ensure remarkable contribution to the welfare of stake-holders, clients and job-seekers. industries: - fmcg, consumer goods & retail - construction, engineering, oil & gas, infrastructure (technical & non-technical) - automotive - property management & real- estate functions across industries (other than above): - sales & marketing - hr & it - finance & accounting

name: Netskope
title: Solutions Engineer
description: about netskope today, there's more data and users outside the enterprise than inside, causing the network perimeter as we know it to dissolve. we realized a new perimeter was needed, one that is built in the cloud and follows and protects data wherever it goes, so we started netskope to redefine cloud, network and data security. since 2012, we have built the market-leading cloud security company and an award-winning culture powered by hundreds of employees spread across offices in santa clara, st. louis, bangalore, london, paris, melbourne, taipei, and tokyo. our core values are openness, honesty, and transparency, and we purposely developed our open desk layouts and large meeting spaces to support and promote partnerships, collaboration, and teamwork. from catered lunches and office celebrations to employee recognition events and social professional groups such as the awesome women of netskope (awon), we strive to keep work fun, supportive and interactive. visit us at netskope careers. please follow us on linkedin and twitter@netskope. about the position: the netskope solutions engineer will come on board with the full support of the executive team. this is an amazing opportunity for the sales professional who has a history of completely dominating their territory and who wants to make an impact on building the next iconic cloud security company. you will work closely with customers and partners as your primary point of contact for feedback and resolution of issues and will be the customers’ advocate for issues that require assistance from the hq support team. you will provide feedback to the product management team on new feature requests and product enhancements from your customer base. heavy travel within the territory is required and as necessary to support other company-based engagements within the us. this is a highly impactful role – you will have a compelling opportunity to impact the business and advance your career. responsibilities include: objective #1 is to exceed our sales targets. articulate the high-level benefits of netskope's architecture to our target audiences (typically senior security management up to ciso and cio). construct best practices for presentations, demos, and proof of concept/value exercises as well as overall win strategy. take an active role in your regions customer success and help resolve any customer satisfaction issues, escalating cross functionally when needed. understand the customer need and establish company's product as the best solution that addresses that customer requirement and provides business value present the netskope cloud security solution to prospective customers create and deliver demonstrations of the products gather customer technical requirements work trade shows as necessary provide insight on competitive solutions and differentiate between them create evaluation test plans with customers and partners and managing the evaluation process to a successful conclusion lead proof-of-concepts (pocs) present at conferences and seminars respond effectively to rfis/rfps job requirements: 7+ years of relevant experience as a solutions/system engineer with a proven track record and demonstrable skills at presenting technical information at the business executive level or at the architect level strong empathy for customers and passion for revenue and growth. strong communication (written and verbal) and presentation skills ranging from tech level up to senior executives. comfortable in public speaking and presenting to both internal and external executive audiences. ability to scale from the whiteboard to working with security architects to influencing cisos. love and passion for helping customers and delivering satisfaction even when faced with difficult customers. demonstrable experience with systems installation, configuration and administration linux, macos and windows-based systems proficient in mobile device technologies (mdm/mam) and os such as android and ios knowledge of certificates, key management systems, hsm and related protocols proven hands-on experience with information security solutions such as web proxy, ngfw, security gateways, working with remote access and site to site vpn technologies, saml/sso, dlp, data security and understand but also write regex expressions experience working with cloud identity providers, scim, siem, soar, edr and sd-wan deployments and integrations experience working with active directory services including adfs, working knowledge of azure ad is desired experience working with public cloud environments (aws, azure and gcp) working knowledge of the broader threat landscape and the ability to distill technology trends, and explain complex behaviors in simple terms travel - within region. experience working in and selling cloud-based technologies (saas, iaas, and paas). desire: demonstrable experience with scripting languages such as python, and rest api framework. prior experience with other vendor cloud security solutions is advantageous. strong security skills that would include hands-on experience with bluecoat, symantec, mcafee, checkpoint, cisco, juniper along with other appropriate certifications (e.g. cissp, ccsk, ccsp, ccse, gcfw, pcnse, jncis-sec/jncip-ent, gcih, etc). agile scrum certification: cspo, csm, or csp | project management certification: pmp advanced level network technology certifications (e.g. ccnp, ccie, ccsp, jncie, etc). education relevant bachelor’s degree; preference for computer science or related degrees #li-cj1 netskope is committed to implementing equal employment opportunities for all employees and applicants for employment. netskope does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices based on religion, race, color, sex, marital or veteran statues, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, genetic information, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), or any other characteristic protected by the laws or regulations of any jurisdiction in which we operate. netskope respects your privacy and is committed to protecting the personal information you share with us, please refer to netskope's privacy policy for more details.

description: company description makkah clock royal tower, a fairmont hotel, is located only a few steps away from the masjid al haram and the holy ka’aba. this 76-story hotel, one of the world’s tallest, is the focal point of the abraj al bait complex, part of the king abdul aziz endowment project, is the iconic symbol of hospitality in the holy city. the hotel authentic hospitality is seen throughout 1650 guest rooms and suites are thoughtfully and elegantly appointed-with extravagant amenities and five-star services that allow for peaceful reflection and repose. raffles makkah palace promises the exceptional standards inherent in the raffles name and enhanced by arab hospitality values. raffles makkah palace offers 214 suites & duplex villas with breathtaking views of the masjid al haram, the holy ka’aba and the city. the hotel combines the best of local cuisine and international dishes in each of its four outlets creating a unique and welcoming atmosphere in this diving setting. guests can also indulge and immerse themselves in a relaxing sensory experience in our world renowned spa and fitness center or hold high-powered business gatherings in any of our state-of-the-art meeting rooms. job description reports to: group digital marketing manager, the group digital marketing assistant manager will oversee digital marketing strategies for makkah clock royal tower and raffles makkah palace. this role focuses on sem (seo, sea), social media, and digital analytics, contributing to one of saudi arabia’s top marketing teams. the ideal candidate should excel in running parallel campaigns across marketing funnels, optimizing strategies using data, and have a strong understanding of social media algorithms. collaboration with the e-commerce team for website and platform updates is also required. a background in digital projects, startups, or entrepreneurship is essential. key responsibilities: 1. digital marketing strategy and execution: develop and implement seo, sea, and social media strategies, optimizing keywords, tags, and hashtags to maximize organic discovery and ai-driven content promotion. conduct thorough keyword research and collaborate with the pr & communications and marketing teams to create keyword-driven content. create meticulously planned content calendars together with digital marketing managers and pr & communications, tailored to each social media platform, and ensure the posting schedule aligns with strategic goals for engagement and growth. manage parallel campaigns across different stages of the marketing funnel for maximum performance and engagement. 2. collaboration with e-commerce and web teams: work closely with the e-commerce team to optimize brand.com performance and boost conversions. collaborate with front-end and back-end engineers, as well as ux designers, to continuously improve user experience and conversion rates. 3. data-driven decision making: use tools like google analytics, semrush, and ahrefs to analyze campaign performance and optimize strategies based on real-time data insights. 4. research and trend analysis: stay updated on social media algorithms, seo trends, and industry best practices. experiment with new tools and techniques to uncover effective digital marketing strategies. qualifications education: bachelor's degree in digital marketing, data science, information technology, or a related field. · completion of relevant courses in marketing, digital marketing, and technical areas such as seo, coding, and data analysis is highly preferred. experience: 3-5 years of digital marketing experience, focusing on seo, sea, sem, and social media. 7+ years of continuous involvement inside projects, startups, or entrepreneurial initiatives. proven experience in building digital communities and managing digital campaigns. successful examples of marketing on x.com (formerly twitter), snapchat and tiktok are highly preferred. experience with game design, after effects, premiere pro, and photoshop is an asset. web3 marketing experience is a plus. tech startup co-founder experience is highly preferred. familiarity with agile methodologies and project management tools. extensive gaming experience across genres is a bonus. requirement: the candidate must have grown an instagram or tiktok page to over 10,000 followers organically and be able to document the process additional information why work for accor? we are far more than a worldwide leader. we welcome you as you are and you can find a job and brand that matches your personality. we support you to grow and learn every day, making sure that work brings purpose to your life, so that during your journey with us, you can continue to explore accor’s limitless possibilities. by joining care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo! #belimitless

name: TAWANTECH
title: DevOps Engineer
description: role overview: are you a tech-savvy innovator with a passion for seamless development and deployment? join us as a devops engineer, where you will play a critical role in revolutionizing how we build, deliver, and scale cutting-edge solutions. your mission is to bridge the gap between development and operations, ensuring agility, reliability, and performance at every stage of the software lifecycle. responsibilities: 1. build and maintain scalable infrastructure: design, implement, and manage scalable, secure, and high-performance infrastructure using modern cloud platforms (aws, azure, gcp). leverage infrastructure as code (iac) tools like terraform, ansible, or cloudformation to automate infrastructure provisioning and management. ensure high availability and disaster recovery planning for critical systems. 2. automate everything: develop and optimize ci/cd pipelines to enable seamless build, test, and deployment workflows. create scripts and tools to automate repetitive tasks, reducing manual intervention and errors. implement monitoring, logging, and alerting systems to proactively identify and resolve issues. 3. collaborate across teams: work closely with developers, qa engineers, and system administrators to ensure smooth integration and deployment of software. serve as a liaison between development and operations teams, advocating for devops best practices. participate in design and architecture discussions to ensure operational excellence. 4. enhance system performance & security: optimize application performance and system efficiency by identifying bottlenecks and implementing solutions. apply security best practices to safeguard infrastructure, applications, and data. conduct regular vulnerability assessments and implement necessary patches or upgrades. 5. champion continuous improvement: foster a culture of continuous delivery, reliability, and innovation. evaluate new tools, technologies, and frameworks, recommending adoption where beneficial. provide mentorship and training to team members to promote devops principles and practices. requirements minimum 4 years of experience in devops, cloud infrastructure, or related fields. bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience). proven experience in managing ci/cd pipelines with tools like jenkins, gitlab ci, or circleci. hands-on expertise in containerization and orchestration tools (e.g., docker, kubernetes). strong scripting skills in python, bash, or similar languages. in-depth understanding of version control systems like git. experience with monitoring tools such as prometheus, grafana, or elk stack. familiarity with service mesh technologies (e.g., istio, linkerd). knowledge of serverless computing and functions-as-a-service (faas). certifications in cloud platforms (e.g., aws certified devops engineer, azure devops engineer).

comprehensive electrical and instrumentation drawings and models to support our construction projects. your work will involve collaborating closely with engineers and project managers to interpret design specifications, ensuring that all drafting work meets industry standards and project requirements. you will utilize advanced drafting software and modeling tools to produce detailed wiring diagrams, layout plans, and instrument data sheets, leveraging your technical expertise to enhance project delivery. if you have a passion for precision and a strong understanding of electrical and instrumentation systems, we would love to have you as part of our innovative team at rawafid, contributing to the successful execution of our projects. responsibilities create electrical and instrumentation drafting and modeling from conceptual designs to detailed construction documents. collaborate with engineering teams to understand project scope and specifications, ensuring accurate and timely deliverables. prepare and review electrical diagrams, including power distribution, control systems, and instrumentations. ensure compliance with industry standards, codes, and regulations in all drafting and modeling activities. review and incorporate feedback from project stakeholders to revise drawings as necessary. participate in design reviews and meetings to ensure alignment with project objectives and timelines. maintain organized documentation and file management of all drawings and revisions. requirements associate diploma degree in electrcal drafting, instrumentation drafting, or electrical engineering technology. autodesk certified professional (acp) in autocad. autodesk certified professional (acp) in revit. certified automation professional. min. 5 years of experience as a draftsman or modeler in the electrical and instrumentation field. proficiency in autocad, revit, sketchup, inventor, eplan, and excel. familiar with iso, astm, asme, ashrae. strong knowledge of electrical and instrumentation standards, codes, and practices. ability to interpret and create complex technical drawings and specifications. excellent attention to detail, with strong analytical and problem-solving skills. ability to work collaboratively with multidisciplinary teams and communicate effectively with stakeholders. benefits salary: competitive salary pay scale, housing allowance, transportation allowance, remote areas allowance. benefits: top healthcare coverage including dental and vision, 13th salary, paid vacation time. features: onboarding and orientation, fixable work hours, long weekends (education callender) flexibility, employee awards & certification. employee support program: performance bonus, promotion, career growth, knowledge & skills development, children education support, car finance assistance, healthcare plan upgrade & parents inclusion.

description: rawafid is excited to announce an opening for a construction planner and time controller who will be instrumental in the successful planning and execution of our construction projects. in this role, you will be responsible for developing detailed project schedules, ensuring that project timelines are followed and milestones are achieved. you will work closely with project managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to understand project requirements and deliverables, while also identifying potential scheduling conflicts and proposing solutions. your analytical skills will be vital in assessing project progress, conducting performance analyses, and implementing corrective measures to meet deadlines. if you have a passion for project planning and a keen eye for detail, we invite you to apply to be a part of our dedicated team at rawafid. your contributions will help us achieve excellence and deliver high-quality projects on time. responsibilities develop and maintain comprehensive project schedules using advanced scheduling techniques and tools. collaborate with project teams to determine key deliverables, milestones, and resource allocations. monitor project progress against established timelines, identifying delays and developing recovery plans. facilitate project meetings with stakeholders to review scheduling issues and adjust timelines as necessary. prepare regular reports and presentations on project timelines, progress, and performance for senior management. implement best practices in planning and scheduling, ensuring alignment with project goals and methodologies. utilize project management software to create gantt charts and other visual aids for tracking progress and maintaining transparency. requirements bachelor's degree in construction management, project management, civil engineering, mechanical engineering, or electrical engineering. certified project management professional (pmp). min. 5 years of experience in project planning or scheduling within the construction industry. proficiency in primavera p6., autocad, revit, aconex, sharepoint, excel, word, costx. strong analytical and organizational skills with a focus on time management. excellent communication and interpersonal skills to work effectively with diverse teams and stakeholders. ability to anticipate potential scheduling challenges and develop proactive solutions. proficient in ms office suite, particularly excel, for data analysis and reporting. benefits salary: competitive salary pay scale, housing allowance, transportation allowance, remote areas allowance benefits: top healthcare coverage including dental and vision, 13th salary, paid vacation time features: onboarding and orientation, fixable work hours, long weekends (education callender) flexibility, employee awards & certification (monthly, milestones recognition) employee programs (subject to eligibility): performance bonus, promotion & career growth, knowledge & skills development, children education support, car finance assistance, healthcare plan upgrade & parents inclusion.

and procedures and support their development as needed. ensure the implementation of operations plans, policies, procedures, and transition/migration plans. monitor the progress of the project as per foundation systems for structures, including conducting calculations. design and analyze various permanent and temporary earth retaining systems such as concrete gravity, soldier beam, and lagging and sheet pile walls, along with associated slope stability analysis utilizing several computerized solution techniques. oversee the plan and program site investigation work taking into consideration any description: *mep tender engineer* * dammam or riyadh - ksa * construction * estimation engineer *general job description:* the position of a tender engineer for electromechanical works (mechanical works such as hvac, plumbing, firefighting and low-current systems, and electrical works such as low-voltage and medium-voltage electrical works, low-current systems, grounding systems, data systems, and bms monitoring and control systems) in a contracting company is a vital position that requires experience and knowledge of contracts and projects, the ability to analyze data, and effectively submit competitive bids. the tender engineer is also responsible for organizing and managing the tender submission and review process. he must possess the ability to handle the technical and financial specifications of contracting projects and prepare appropriate and accurate technical and commercial proposals for clients. *primary responsibilities of a tender engineer:* * analyze legal documents and contracts related to tenders and projects. * submit competitive bids to secure new projects. * communicate with clients and sales and production teams to ensure they have the necessary information to submit optimal bids. * verify the accuracy of the information collected to determine the required costs and specifications for the project. * evaluate the potential risks of projects and ensure compliance with the required conditions and standards. * determine the time required to complete projects in coordination with the project management team and identify the resources necessary to complete the project according to the required specifications. * supervise the preparation of the required financial and technical proposals for projects. * maintaining good relationships with clients, suppliers, contractors, and government agencies involved in the project. *basic skills: * * good knowledge of projects, contracts, laws, and regulations related to tendering. * analytical, estimating, and planning skills. * ability to manage time and work under pressure. * good communication skills and the ability to deal efficiently with clients and other work teams. * good knowledge of office programs such as excel, word, powerpoint, etc. * good knowledge & experience with the estimation software and programs. *essential competencies:* * the ability to assume responsibility and make difficult and appropriate decisions promptly. * attention to detail and accuracy in work. * the ability to work independently and as part of a team. * the ability to learn and improve the skills required for the job. * the ability to innovate and think creatively to improve the bidding and contracting process. *essential qualifications and experience:* * a bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering or any mep-related discipline. * 3-5 years of gulf experience. * previous experience in tenders and bidding at a contracting company, government institution, or private company. * good knowledge of tender regulations, laws, and systems. * ability to analyze, estimate, plan, and manage time. * ability to use the necessary programs to prepare tenders and bids. * ability to use pricing programs and software. * good communication skills and the ability to work independently and as part of a team. job type: full-time pay: from ﷼3,500.00 per month

skills, and the ability to work with diverse teams to deliver complex road projects. the ideal candidate will be a seasoned professional with a passion for road engineering and the ability to lead and standards, and environmental requirements. develop road layouts, alignments, cross-sections, drainage systems, and pavement designs. use design software (e.g., autocad, civil 3d, or similar tools) to infrastructure are completed to specification. ensure that all phases of the project, from design to construction, meet contractual, budgetary, and timeline requirements. monitor construction progress municipal and regulatory requirements. coordinate with environmental specialists to integrate eco-friendly practices and address environmental concerns in the project. quality control and compliance: progressing in line with the approved designs and specifications. supervise testing and quality assurance processes for road materials, pavement strength, and other relevant testing. traffic analysis and management: conduct traffic flow analysis to determine road capacity and optimize design for maximum efficiency and safety. incorporate intelligent traffic systems (its), road safety barriers, and other technologies to improve traffic management. analyze traffic data and adjust road designs as necessary to mitigate congestion and ensure safety. risk management and safety: identify potential risks during the design and construction phases and propose mitigation strategies. ensure that all road designs are safe for all users, including drivers, pedestrians, and cyclists. promote and ensure development: mentor and provide technical leadership to junior engineers and support staff, helping them develop their skills and expertise. lead and manage multidisciplinary teams, ensuring all team road safety regulations, materials, pavement design, and drainage systems. skills & knowledge: expertise in using road design software (e.g., autocad, civil 3d, or similar tools). in-depth knowledge timely performance of cost control activities. interfaces with designated bechtel management and client counterparts for specific cost presentations. prepares and presents cost engineering information to management/client. reviews project work activities to ensure support of project milestones. coordinates and establishes scoping requirements for the overall cost estimate by discipline or other specialty, and coordinates the timely, systematic, and complete acquisition of scope definition and related data. supervises the collection, verification, and integration of work scope for all entities into a total project plan. performs productivity analysis of construction operations and verifies results. establishes productivity basis to be utilized in estimates, as developed with the concurrence of construction. reviews labor estimates for reasonableness. coordinates pricing structure or criteria to be used by each discipline or specialty to meet the objectives of the cost estimate. establishes format and content of summaries and reconciliations, including segregation of cost according to level of confidence and identification of areas of risk. responsible for the development, maintenance and update of the project trend and change control program. responsible for the deployment of all essential tools to properly manage change control on the project. plans, organizes, and supervises project cost budgets. supervises the development, maintenance and update of the project cost and commitment (coco) dashboard and ensures that timely updates are provided to project management. performs contingency analyses and works closely with the project risk management to reconcile project trend register and the project risk register. develop contingency drawdown / release curves, as requested by project management. supervises the estimating / cost engineering duties related to bechtel services on the project i.e. job hours reporting, services cost reports, revenue and gross margin calculations, and supervises the preparing of the project financials status report (pfsr). supervises cost recording, monitoring, and reporting practices for compliance with applicable standards accuracy and consistency. conducts personnel performance reviews when delegated. interviews candidates and makes recommendations for employment decisions. education and experience requirements: grade 26: requires bachelor's degree (or international equivalent) plus minimum of 15 years of relevant experience. grade 27: requires bachelor's degree (or international equivalent) plus minimum of 17 years of relevant experience. the cost manager will be a key member of the project team and will report to the project controls manager. have previous project controls project experience within ksa or the wider middle east and across a broad range of infrastructure projects. show knowledge of engineering and construction management customarily acquired over time through specialized instruction or practical experience. show a working knowledge of change management; and have experience of knowledge transfer and the development of local employees. required knowledge and skills: experience in performing, monitoring, and reviewing cost engineering functions, including cost estimating, cost control, financial reporting systems, and cost analysis, in the field and the home office. statistical knowledge in the areas of sampling distributions, probability, and hypothesis testing. knowledge in supervision, personnel administration, and training of technical and non-technical personnel. demonstrated ability to plan, organize, direct, perform, review, and present cost engineering and cost estimating products. this includes planning and scheduling products independently with minimal supervision using a high level of professional judgment and knowledge related to technical planning and scheduling skills and engineering design and construction practices. skilled in oral and written communication. advanced level of knowledge of engineering, procurement, contracts, construction, and startup work processes, as performed by bechtel. knowledge of engineering and construction management customarily acquired over time through specialized instruction or practical experience. total rewards/benefits: for decades, bechtel has worked to inspire the next generation of employees and beyond! because our teams face some of the world's toughest challenges, we offer robust benefits to ensure our people thrive. whether it is advancing careers, delivering programs to enhance our culture, or providing time to recharge, bechtel has the benefits to build a legacy of sustainable growth. learn more at bechtel total rewards diverse teams build the extraordinary: as a global company, bechtel has long been home to a vibrant multitude of nationalities, cultures, ethnicities, and life experiences. this diversity has made us a more trusted partner, more effective problem solvers and innovators, and a more attractive destination for leading talent. we are committed to being a company where every colleague feels that they belong-where colleagues feel part of "one team," respected and rewarded for what they bring, supported in pursuing their goals, invested in our values and purpose, and treated equitably. bechtel is an equal opportunity employer. all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, national origin, disability, citizenship status (except as authorized by law), protected veteran status, genetic information, and any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. applicants with a disability, who require a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process, may e-mail their request to acesstmt@bechtel.com

name: Vanderlande Industries
title: Controls Support Engineer
description: job title controls support engineer job description control support engineer (controls & automation) are you looking to develop your career in continuous operations of the automation and information technologies in baggage handling system (bhs) at istanbul airport, and satisfy your ambitions at a company where you can aspire to new heights, enjoy personal growth, and thrive on achievement? at vanderlande, we are seeking passionate and ambitious people, capable of making a positive impact on the quality of our service delivery to our customer by ensuring a high-performance baggage flow operation for the entire airport, while developing a prosperous career in a fast-paced international environment. your responsibilities analyzing & reporting of the system performance (plcs and baggage flow), and undefined behavior and phenomena of the system, as well as the functional reports and specific flow situations creating shift reports and raising any problems in the automation system of the baggage flow line and debugging; coordinating with maintenance / scada team or open a ticket as needed executing the lifecycle of open tickets locally or through global service desk proper reporting between shifts and communicating with the stakeholders analyzing and filtering events which are potential incidents working on priority 1 and 2 incidents when escalated, resolving them within sla delivering the preventive maintenance tasks & assigned change tasks (back-ups, patch execution, etc.) creating documentation such as manuals, programming diagrams, network diagrams, and work instructions performance analysis on the tickets and performance review with functional managers. creating new or updating the existing processes according the change management process to increase the efficiency studying developments on product lines, working with the latest and current firmware updates of the products managed by the llc team, and updating the information in the synergy database your qualifications and skills as an enthusiastic low-level control engineer you have the following skills: initiator and follower on engineering solutions strong customer focus a clear communicator, able to communicate at all levels, able to provide clear and concise information to stakeholders and management team player and adaptable personality, willing to broaden skills outside core skillset and develops / mentors other team members proactive (focus on service improvements) eager to learn. have the ability to dig into technical problems in its own areas, at the same time to maintain the overview on the system, software, and system behavior have very good analytical skills and able to think “out-of-the-box” ability to work under pressure on mission-critical systems good attention to detail and ability to work to a high standard good scheduler and performer in highly planned task regime able and willing to work in shifts you should also have: a bachelor’s degree in electrical, mechatronics engineering or similar understandings on plc, scada (wincc), industrial networking systems including ethernet/ip, profinet, as-i network and plc communications, experience in programming siemens plc’s understanding of sql databases and reporting, as well as the diverse it components (preferable) itil foundation knowledge (preferable) certification on one or more of the above items (preferable) 3-5 years of experience on one or more of the above items, as well as automated material handling systems ability to create customer documentation such as user manuals, programming diagrams, network diagrams, and electrical drawings excellent communication skills, writing and speaking, in the turkish and the english language residency in istanbul or willing to move there, within commuting distance of the new airport our company vanderlande is the global market leader for future-proof logistic process automation at airports – from london heathrow to singapore changi – and in the parcel market, for main players such as ups and fedex. furthermore, we are also a leading supplier of solutions for warehousing giants, including one of the largest e-commerce leaders providing logistics, payments, hardware, data storage, and media solutions, which seamlessly integrate innovative systems, intelligent software and life-cycle services. if you aspire to a position of responsibility – and want to make a difference by facilitating the delivery of what matters most to consumers, passengers, and businesses – then the next step on your path to global opportunities is to join vanderlande. as part of our network and unique culture of freedom and flexibility, you will be connected to our dedicated people, build strong relationships, and rise to the challenge of industry-leading projects. you will grow, take ownership, and make every day better as you continue on the road to success with your spirit of adventure – and fulfil your ambitions for personal development through our academy. vanderlande will give you the necessary knowledge, tools and support, so that together we have the confidence and ability to exceed our customers’ expectations in over 100 countries. to achieve our collective goals, you will have a hands-on role working in a positive environment to deliver tangible, state-of-the-art products and improve the competitiveness of our highly visible customers. as an integral part of our team, you will have the enthusiasm and be driven to reach our destination before your next journey with vanderlande begins… your application so, if you would like to join a profitable and growing company that will enable you to reach your goals and focus on your future, then you may apply now by completing the application with your cv and covering letter. diversity & inclusion disclaimer vanderlande is an equal opportunity employer. qualified applicants will be considered without regards to race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

name: Parsons
title: Survey Manager
description: in a world of possibilities, pursue one with endless opportunities. imagine next! when it comes to what you want in your career, if you can imagine it, you can do it at parsons. imagine a career working with intelligent, diverse people sharing a common quest. imagine a workplace where you can be yourself. where you can thrive. where you can find your next, right now. we’ve got what you’re looking for. job description: parsons is looking for an amazingly talented survey manager to join our team! in this role, you will oversee all surveying activities, ensure data accuracy, lead a team of surveyors, and ensure compliance with airfield safety and regulatory standards. this role requires a strong technical background in land surveying, leadership skills, and the ability to collaborate with multiple stakeholders to support the successful execution of the airfield project. . what you'll be doing; develop and implement comprehensive surveying plans for airfield projects, including control surveys, boundary surveys, topographic surveys, and construction staking. coordinate with design engineers, contractors, and other stakeholders to ensure alignment of surveying activities with project timelines and goals. manage surveying resources, including personnel and equipment, to ensure efficiency and accuracy in data collection. oversee and conduct field surveys, ensuring all data is gathered accurately using modern surveying tools such as gps, total stations, and lidar. analyze collected data to produce accurate topographic maps, as-built surveys, and other reports required by engineers and project stakeholders. ensure that all survey data complies with project specifications and regulatory standards for airfield operations. implement and maintain quality control processes for surveying activities, ensuring all outputs are precise and meet industry standards. prepare and review survey reports, technical drawings, and documentation for accuracy and completeness. provide regular progress updates and technical reports to senior management, highlighting any issues or challenges that arise during surveying operations. ensure that all surveying activities on the airfield adhere to safety protocols and comply with aviation regulations, including those set by icao, faa, and other relevant authorities. conduct risk assessments for surveying operations and develop strategies to mitigate potential hazards associated with airfield environments. lead and manage a team of surveyors, providing mentorship, technical guidance, and professional development opportunities. conduct performance reviews, setting goals for team members and ensuring that surveying activities are executed efficiently and accurately. foster a collaborative team environment focused on high performance, safety, and quality. oversee the selection, calibration, and maintenance of surveying equipment, ensuring it is in optimal working condition for accurate data collection. stay updated on technological advancements in surveying tools and techniques, incorporating relevant innovations to improve survey processes. maintain effective communication with project managers, contractors, engineers, and regulatory authorities to ensure alignment on surveying objectives and project progress. provide clear and actionable insights based on survey data to support project decision-making and design modifications. ensure compliance with all local, state, and federal regulations related to airfield surveying, land use, and construction. maintain thorough and organized records of survey data, reports, and project documentation for future reference and audits. what required skills you'll bring; bachelor’s degree in surveying, geomatics, civil engineering, or a related field. professional certifications such as professional land surveyor (pls) or equivalent are preferred. minimum of 7-10 years of experience in surveying, with at least 3-5 years in managing airfield or aviation-related surveying projects proven track record of conducting and managing surveys for complex infrastructure projects, particularly in airfield environments. strong proficiency with surveying tools and software, including gps, total stations, autocad, civil 3d, and trimble business center. in-depth knowledge of airfield infrastructure and design, as well as aviation safety standards (icao, faa). excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to manage teams and work with diverse project stakeholders. strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret and analyze complex survey data. what desired skills you'll bring; professional certifications such as pls, or equivalent, and knowledge of airfield safety operations. experience with lidar, drone surveying, or gis technologies. familiarity with airfield construction practices and regulations, including runway/taxiway design and drainage systems. ability to identify opportunities for process optimization, leveraging new technologies and methodologies to improve efficiency and data accuracy. parsons equally employs representation at all job levels no matter the race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, age, disability or genetic information. we truly invest and care about our employee’s wellbeing and provide endless growth opportunities as the sky is the limit, so aim for the stars! imagine next and join the parsons quest—apply today! parsons is aware of fraudulent recruitment practices. to learn more about recruitment fraud and how to report it, please refer to https://www.parsons.com/fraudulent-recruitment/ .
label: Other
LLM_soft_skills: leadership, communication, teamwork, problem-solving, collaboration, mentorship, adaptability
LLM_tools: GPS, total stations, Lidar, AutoCAD, Civil 3D, Trimble Business Center
LLM_technical_skills: land surveying, airfield infrastructure, aviation safety standards, data analysis, surveying methodologies, risk assessment, quality control, airfield construction practices, process optimization, GIS technologies

name: Air Products
title: Electrical Engineer
description: at air products, our purpose is to bring people together to reimagine what’s possible, collaborate and innovate solutions to the world’s most significant energy and environmental sustainability challenges. grow with us as we embark on building tomorrow together by being the safest, most diverse and most profitable industrial gas company in the world. reimagine what’s possible purpose to lead in providing electrical engineering oversight to ensure safe & reliable operation of plant facilities under jigpc in jazan, saudi arabia. nature & scope properly functioning electrical systems and equipment are critical to the safe, reliable, and efficient operation of the plant facilities and associated equipment & systems. as a member of the site engineering team, the sr. electrical engineer will lead to interact routinely with plant operations, maintenance, and engineering personnel to provide “hands-on” field-engineering & troubleshooting support, instructions, and technical guidance related to the site’s electrical systems & equipment including: large high voltage induction and synchronous motors and starting systems including reduced voltage autotransformers, electrical protection relays, low voltage and high voltage distribution systems, high voltage power-factor-compensation units, motor control centers & switchgear, and a variety of specialized electronic / electrical equipment. the position emphasizes teamwork, communications, organization, change management, work process optimization, planning, leadership, and hands-on technical skills with comprehensive knowledge across engineering disciplines. principal accountabilities safety provide & maintain a safe work environment for self & others. employ good housekeeping methods and demonstrate leadership with all company & industry safe work processes to prevent injuries. engineering: lead in the provision of engineering evaluation & determinations, issue technical direction & guidance, and oversee inspection & quality assurance initiatives for all electrical troubleshooting, maintenance, calibration, repair, and test activities. lead in the provision of engineering support & guidance during the construction & commissioning of the plants. maintain accurate documentation for plant’s electrical equipment and validate single line electrical drawings for the plant’s electrical distribution systems. monitor quality assurance initiatives. lead in performing electrical system studies including short circuit, load flow, transient motor start, protection relay coordination, arc flash, etc., and establish appropriate protective device settings. lead in the provision of engineering guidance to ensure reliability and maintainability of equipment, processes, utilities, facilities, controls, and safety/security systems. lead in the provision of engineering input for development and maintenance of electrical systems & equipment standards, procedures, best practices, inspection contracts, and contractor selection guidelines. develop detailed engineering specifications, evaluate quotations, perform technical bid evaluations & vendor document review, and validate factory acceptance testing related to the procurement of electrical equipment and system components. maintain compliance with all critical safety circuits (css), safety integrity levels (sil), and safety instrumented systems (sis) implementation and revalidation programs. develop, implement, and manage a comprehensive risk-based inspection and calibration program for all electrical systems & equipment. establish & maintain a relationship with the local inspection bureau, maintain relevant statutory, regulatory, technology standards, and code information consistent with jigpc plant operational objectives and local regulations. utilize predictive and other non-destructive inspection & test methodologies to identify and isolate inherent reliability problems. employ appropriate project development and project management activities (including scope, budget, schedule, execution strategies, risk plans, cost collection / reporting, etc.) for the execution of all projects and turnaround activities. provide engineering support to develop the annual budget for electrical systems & equipment maintenance, repair, and major turn-around activities. promote an atmosphere of team spirit through good example, open communication, good listening, and timely problem resolutions. drive continuous improvement in safety performance, reliability, and cost of quality goals. establish & maintain relationships with regional pressure system equipment suppliers foster and support positive working relationships with internal and external customers. participate at professional association meetings to determine best practices being used in the industry and apply them to our pressure systems. job requirements engineering graduate (bsee preferred) with >12 years of relevant experience in electrical chemical / refinery / gas plant maintenance / inspection / engineering. demonstrated knowledge & experience performing detailed power system engineering studies including short circuit, load flow, transient motor start, protection relay coordination, arc flash, etc., and establish appropriate protective device settings. knowledge & understanding with the principles of: safety integrity level (sil), safety instrumented system (sis), safety instrumented function (sif), supervisory control and data acquisition (scada) knowledge of industry codes and standards applicable to oil and gas and refining industries (api, isa, nec / iec, nfpa, asme, etc.) and preferably also saudi aramco standards and working practices experience in leading and guiding technical employees needed. we are the world’s largest hydrogen producer with over 80 years of industrial gas experience. we are hydrogen and industrial gas experts delivering safe, end-to-end solutions, investing in real, clean energy projects at scale, and driving the industry forward to generate a cleaner future. at air products, we work in an environment where we put safety first, diversity is essential, inclusion is our culture, and each person knows they belong and matter. to learn more, visit about air products.
label: Other
LLM_soft_skills: communication, teamwork, leadership, organization, change management, planning, problem-solving, relationship building, continuous improvement, adaptability
LLM_tools: safety integrity level (SIL), safety instrumented system (SIS), supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA), industry codes and standards (API, ISA, NEC/IEC, NFPA, ASME), electrical equipment documentation, predictive inspection methodologies
LLM_technical_skills: electrical engineering, power system engineering, electrical troubleshooting, maintenance, calibration, repair, quality assurance, risk-based inspection, non-destructive testing, project management, electrical system studies

name: Air Products
title: Instrumentation & Control Engineer - Power Block
description: at air products, our purpose is to bring people together to reimagine what’s possible, collaborate and innovate solutions to the world’s most significant energy and environmental sustainability challenges. grow with us as we embark on building tomorrow together by being the safest, most diverse and most profitable industrial gas company in the world. reimagine what’s possible purpose to provide the support to the commissioning/engineering team in the instrument & controls engineering oversight to ensure the safe and smooth commissioning activities of igcc power plant facilities under jigpc in jazan, saudi arabia. nature & scope the jazan igcc is the world’s largest igcc and asu facility producing 2100 mmscfd syngas, 18,000 mt/day oxygen and 4 gigawatts of power. facilities and assets include residue gasification, acid gas clean up (rectisol), soot ash recovery, sulphur recovery (claus & scot), combined cycle power plants, materials handling systems, hydrogen recovery, air separation, water utilities systems and wastewater treatment facilities. properly functioning instrumentation & controls are critical to the safe, reliable, and efficient operation of the plant facilities and associated equipment & systems. as a member of the site engineering team, the senior instrument engineer will lead to interact routinely with plant operations, maintenance, and other engineering personnel to provide “hands-on” dcs, field-engineering & troubleshooting support, instructions, and technical guidance related to the site’s instrumentation & controls systems. the position emphasizes teamwork, communications, organization, change management, work process optimization, planning, leadership, and hands-on technical skills with comprehensive knowledge across other engineering disciplines. principal accountabilities safety: •provide & maintain a safe work environment for self & others. employ good housekeeping methods and demonstrate leadership with all company & industry safe work processes to prevent injuries. engineering: you will provide process control engineering technical input and task leadership across the following: •support in the provision of engineering evaluation & determinations, issue technical direction & guidance, and oversee inspection & quality assurance initiatives for all instrument & controls systems & equipment troubleshooting, maintenance, calibration, repair, and test activities support in the provision of engineering support & guidance during the commissioning of power plant. maintain accurate document control and monitor quality assurance initiatives. •support in the development of detailed engineering specifications (including sizing calculations) for the procurement of instrument & controls systems components and equipment. •support in the provision of engineering input for development and maintenance of instrument & controls systems & equipment standards, procedures, best practices, inspection contracts, and contractor selection guidelines. •implement and maintain compliance with all critical safety circuits (css), safety integrity levels (sil), and safety instrumented systems (sis) implementation and revalidation programs. •provide engineering support for the troubleshooting, maintenance, calibration, repair, and test activities for the plant’s gas analyzers and flow meters. •develop, implement, and manage a comprehensive risk-based inspection and calibration program for all instrument & controls systems & equipments. •drive continuous improvement in safety performance, reliability, and cost of quality goals. •participate in professional association meetings to determine best practices being used in the industry and apply them to our instrument & controls systems & equipment. •support, mentor, and develop local i&c engineers. job requirements 1.engineering graduate in electronics discipline with 10 years of relevant experience specifically in power plant o&m or in commissioning of power projects. 2.experience with siemens sppa-t3000 and/or honeywell experion distributed control system (dcs), field instrumentation, gas analyzers, and control valves. a fundamental understanding of computer networks is desirable. 3.troubleshooting and servicing of field instruments & control system of hrsgs, gas turbines, steam turbines, bop, liquid fuel oil and fuel gas loops. 4.responsible for compliance with safety management systems. 5.knowledge & understanding of the principles of safety integrity level (sil), safety instrumented system (sis), safety instrumented function (sif), supervisory control and data acquisition (scada). 6.should be able to develop/change the control logics according the mocs. 7.experience in gas and water analyzers/sampling systems, analog controls, logic controls and profibus is desirable. 8.detailed knowledge of pid controllers. 9.demonstrated “hands-on” ability to configure, calibrate, troubleshoot, and repair various plant process instrumentation related to temperature, pressure, flow, voltage, and other plant process variables. 10.candidates should also possess demonstrated troubleshooting and problem-solving skills, and an ability to think logically and systematically. we are the world’s largest hydrogen producer with over 80 years of industrial gas experience. we are hydrogen and industrial gas experts delivering safe, end-to-end solutions, investing in real, clean energy projects at scale, and driving the industry forward to generate a cleaner future. at air products, we work in an environment where we put safety first, diversity is essential, inclusion is our culture, and each person knows they belong and matter. to learn more, visit about air products.
label: Other

LLM_tools: Siemens SPPA-T3000, Honeywell Experion DCS, SCADA, Profibus
LLM_technical_skills: instrumentation, controls engineering, troubleshooting, maintenance, calibration, risk-based inspection, safety instrumented systems, safety integrity level, process control, gas analyzers, flow meters, PID controllers, control logic development

diagram, isometric drawings, installation standard,...etc.). participate in developing and implementing the quality control processes and procedures for various electrical systems like itp, check compliance with industry standards and project specifications. ensure that all quality control activities comply with relevant industry standards, regulatory requirements, and company policies. recommendations. responsible for the qc documents of the complete project, including certificates, calibration, test results, inspection requests, non-compliance reports and site instruction/observations, permanent materials delivered, and other important qc documents. assist the project's team in ensuring knowledge of all quality standards, compliance with all quality manuals and procedures, and collaboration with contractors and suppliers to maintain the quality of all systems. perform on-site inspections on suppliers and subcontractors to ensure compliance with quality requirements. personal skills excellent problem-solving and analytical skills. strong attention to detail and accuracy. effective communication and interpersonal skills. ability to work independently systems, elv systems (fire alarm, cctv, acs, bms, audio visual, lighting control…), data communication systems (active and passive), and associated components, standards, and codes. • familiarity with aramco quality standards and industry regulations. • strong understanding of quality control methodologies and tools. • proficiency in conducting inspections, tests, and measurements on electrical name: Air Products
title: Process Engineer Utilities / ASU
description: at air products, our purpose is to bring people together to reimagine what’s possible, collaborate and innovate solutions to the world’s most significant energy and environmental sustainability challenges. grow with us as we embark on building tomorrow together by being the safest, most diverse and most profitable industrial gas company in the world. reimagine what’s possible scope the jazan igcc (integrated gasification combined cycle) is the world’s largest igcc power plant facility processing vacuum residue to generate syngas. further processing units include acid gas removal, soot ash recovery, sulphur recovery and hydrogen purification. the combined cycle power generation plant consists of syngas/ulsd fired gas turbines, hrsgs, and steam turbines. extensive utilities including water treatment, wastewater treatment and instrument air. the facility is in the jazan economic city, in the province of jazan, ksa. as a process engineer at jazan igcc you will support technical engineering and operations team to execute plan performance test and operations optimizations work under the direction of csu&pt engineering leader. the performance testing engineer role in the engineering space focuses on ensuring that systems, equipment, or processes meet specified performance standards and function optimally under various conditions. their primary responsibilities are to evaluate, test, and optimize the performance of engineering systems to ensure they operate efficiently and meet quality, safety, and regulatory standards role responsibilities safety provide & maintain a safe work environment for self & others. employ good housekeeping methods and demonstrate leadership with all company & industry safe work processes to prevent injuries. engineering analyze existing plant processes and identify areas for improvement to enhance efficiency, quality, and productivity. implement process changes to reduce waste, improve energy efficiency, and optimize plant operations. design, execute, and analyze plant performance tests to assess the efficiency and reliability of systems and equipment. evaluate performance data to identify optimization opportunities and provide actionable recommendations. collect and analyze process data to monitor plant performance and identify trends or deviations. prepare technical reports summarizing test results, process performance, and optimization recommendations for management and stakeholders. investigate operational issues, identify root causes, and implement corrective actions to restore optimal plant performance. provide technical support to operations and maintenance teams for resolving complex process-related problems. implement process improvement methodologies (e.g., lean, six sigma) to drive efficiency and reduce costs. work with cross-functional teams to develop and refine standard operating procedures and ensure process consistency. collaborate with operations, maintenance, and safety teams to ensure safe and efficient process operations. provide technical advice and training plant personnel on process improvements and best practices. ensure compliance with safety, environmental, and regulatory standards in all process activities. participate in risk assessments, process hazard analysis, and safety audits to ensure safe plant operations. lead or participate in process improvement projects aimed at enhancing plant performance and capacity. coordinate with engineering and other departments to ensure timely and effective project execution. monitor and maintain process control systems to ensure stability and efficiency. collaborate with maintenance teams to ensure that plant equipment is operating at peak performance. assist in troubleshooting and resolving equipment failures that affect plant performance. maintain process documentation, including p&ids, flow diagrams, and operating procedures. ensure proper record-keeping for all process tests, optimizations, and maintenance activities. job requirements bachelor’s degree (or higher) in chemical engineering with minimum of 10 years’ experience in relevant process engineering role. process operational experience within the utility units - seawater reverse osmosis desalination, water demineralization, mbbr wastewater treatment technology, tankage, flare and fuel gas system strong skills in process flow analysis, p&id interpretation, and process documentation. experience with process control and automation systems, including advanced process control strategies. strong communication skills, to enable effective interaction with the rest of the engineering, operation, maintenance, and commissioning team. good interpersonal and teamwork skills with the ability to communicate clearly and effectively throughout all levels within the organization. critical thinking skills and problem-solving capability. experience in the use of pi process book for generating historical data and lims for laboratory analytical data. experience in process simulation tools; aspen hysis, promax tsweet. we are the world’s largest hydrogen producer with over 80 years of industrial gas experience. we are hydrogen and industrial gas experts delivering safe, end-to-end solutions, investing in real, clean energy projects at scale, and driving the industry forward to generate a cleaner future. at air products, we work in an environment where we put safety first, diversity is essential, inclusion is our culture, and each person knows they belong and matter. to learn more, visit about air products.

name: KBR
title: Reliability Engineer
description: title: reliability engineer 10+ years of experience in maintenance and reliability engineering preferably in oil and gas/petrochemical domain. experience in static and rotating equipment, instrument and electrical system and understanding their failure modes and potential solutions is desirable. shall be aware of all the key performance indicators related to reliability of plant operation and be able to support and drive those kpi’s. carried out minimum three to four end-to-end rcm studies. experience in developing asset hierarchy, performing asset prioritization, developing failure modes and effects using reliability centered maintenance approach (rcm) experience in performing safety instrument function (sif) analysis and lopa, and hazop will be added advantage. experience with operations, maintenance, pre-commissioning, commissioning and hand-over activities is an advantage experience in administering the asset lifecycle management procedures such as asset criticality ranking, sap taxonomy, asset operating limits [iow], asset maintenance development procedures, and master data developments in sap, bill of materials bom in sap, active sap-pms implementation and effectiveness hands-on experience in maintenance of equipment including the dismantling, assembly, and inspection of critical equipment (compressors, boiler feed pumps, generators, reformers, pressure vessels, heat exchangers, valves etc.) knowledge in plant reliability and maintenance. good understanding of cmms and reliability software applications knowledge in defining business processes related to reliability and maintenance for process plants experience in analyzing the maintenance data from systems such as system 1, smart signal, etc. will be added advantage high level implementation experience or knowledge in two or more of the following software products: cmms/eam like sap pm and apm tools like ge meridium, bentley apm the primary role will be to design and develop maintenance strategies for different assets in the plant. the main activities are: perform rcm, studies for equipment/systems and recommend maintenance strategies conduct design workshops with client to develop maintenance strategies develop failure modes, indicators to detect failure modes to prepare framework and methodology for criticality assessment and reliability improvement program of clients’ assets. to lead and perform asset criticality analysis. to collect all data for criticality assessment, lead/conduct asset criticality assessment workshops, compilation of workshop finding in suitable reports and populate the data in required format for uploading in sap with supporting documents. develop preventive and corrective maintenance plans for assets shall initiate and conduct essential studies for facilities and operational asset improvements, while providing specialized technical service in relevant engineering disciplines, acts as a consultant on complex engineering problems, designs, and/or projects, coordinates with plant-wide teams. responsible to adapt lessons learned from benchmark and safety cases identified from events, providing recommendations - in consultation with management to provide continuous assurance methodology is applied to sustain the health of safety-critical equipment’s concerning total reliability program are sufficient to mitigate any potential threats arising from changes in major hazard scenarios. shall work with multidisciplinary teams assigned to analyses specific integrity and performance analysis and suggest methods for the prevention of chronic failures. support to review the total reliability program kpis. collaboratively work with team, peers, and client to successfully implement maintenance and reliability solution soft skills requirements including excellent written and verbal english communications skill with proven ability to communicate technical issues to non-technical individuals willing to travel to site and stay for short as well as longer periods build client relationships should have worked in large teams and should be a good team player bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering or relevant engineering with sound fundamentals and technical skills in his discipline is required. certifications related to maintenance and reliability (cmrp/cmrl) will be added advantage the candidate should have training, experience, and/or certification as rcm facilitator and should be able to facilitate rca, aca and rcm process.
